children.name: extrasensory perception
children.definition: (abbESP) the ability to know things without using hearing, seeing, touch, taste or smell khả năng ngoại cảm
examples: Nearly half or more believe in extrasensory perception or ESP.

children.name: telepathy
children.definition: the ability to know what is in sb else's mind or communicate with them mentally, without using words or other physical signals: ngoại cảm (khả năng biết được ý nghĩ, tình cảm của người khác)
examples: I believe in the sixth sense, telepathy and rebirth as I have experienced it.
a team of telepathic superheroes who can read each other's thoughts

children.name: palmistry
children.definition: / palm reading the skill and activity of looking at the lines on the inside of people's hands and claiming to be able to see signs about their character and future: thuật xem chỉ tay
examples: readsb'spalm[VP]to look at the lines on the inside of someone's hand and tell them what these lines say about their character and their future : đọc lòng bàn tay

children.name: second sight
children.definition: an unusual ability that some people are thought to have that allows them to know without being told what will happen in the future or what is happening in a different place: linh cảm
examples: it was like having second sight, the sense that something terrible was going to happen

children.name: divination
children.definition: the skill or act of saying or discovering what will happen in the future: bói toán
examples: All such forms of divination seem to be based on sympathetic magic and cold reading.
